meanings.definition: The position or status of being a doctor.
meanings.sent1: Her doctorship was evident as she confidently walked through the hospital halls.
meanings.sent2: In the hospital, the doctorship of the head physician was respected by all.
meanings.sent3: The doctorship of the young medical student was put to the test during her first surgery.
meanings.sent4: His doctorship shone through as he calmly handled the emergency room chaos.
meanings.sent5: The doctorship of the experienced surgeon saved many lives during the crisis.

meanings.definition: The skill or knowledge of a doctor.
meanings.sent1: His doctorship in diagnosing rare diseases was unmatched in the medical community.
meanings.sent2: The doctorship of the pediatrician was evident in her gentle care for children.
meanings.sent3: The doctorship of the new intern was put to the test during a complex surgery.
meanings.sent4: Her doctorship in treating elderly patients with care and respect was truly admirable.
meanings.sent5: The doctorship of the neurosurgeon was crucial in saving the patient's life.

meanings.definition: The act of practicing medicine as a doctor.
meanings.sent1: After years of study, she finally began her doctorship at the local clinic.
meanings.sent2: His doctorship involved long hours at the hospital, caring for those in need.
meanings.sent3: The doctorship of the medical team was put to the test during the flu outbreak.
meanings.sent4: Her doctorship in the emergency room was a testament to her dedication to helping others.
meanings.sent5: The doctorship of the paramedics was crucial in providing immediate care to the accident victims.
